> > And there is also the issue of code completion when 
> > defining expec=
tations. With JMock, it does not work, you 
> > have to rely on text comple=
tion features.
> > With EasyMock, it works like a charm.
> 
> I do admit th=
at this is a shortcoming, but I don't find that annoying 
> when I use jMoc=
k. In fact, in an odd way, if I find I really 
> want code completion when =
defining fakes or expectations, then perhaps
my 
> interface is too complex=
. :)

This raises an issue which I don't *think* I've seen mentioned here.
=

I find that there's a bit of a benefit when writing test code with
EasyMoc=
k (either version) in that after typing in what I want to be
called before =
it exists, I can then ask Eclipse to generate all the
methods for me, in bo=
th the interface and the class. The tests really do
drive the code - it's o=
nly when a test requires a method to be present
that it gets put in the int=
erface, because I don't end up writing the
interface declarations by hand i=
n the first place. (Of course, I add
documentation and might change the par=
ameter names later, but that's a
different matter.)

Just a small benefit, =
but I thought I'd mention it...

Jon (a very happy EasyMock user)
